page.title: 06Plaxtol School
page.content:
Plaxtol has had its own village{school since 1846, providing primary{ {education}for children in the village and surrounding farms and hamlets.
In 1961 a new{school}was built next to the old one, which became the village Memorial Hall. It consists of a hall, 3 classrooms, a kitchen and an office, and overlooks its own playing field and playground. The{school}has its own outdoor heated swimming pool, paid for by the Parent-Teacher Association.
Children start{school}between the ages of 4\ and 5 and leave to attend Secondary Schools at the age of 11.
There is also a{playgroup}in the village which caters for children of pre-school age.
